channel.title: ComServer Robotics - First Bot Server (RC1)
channel.description:
[center][b]ComServer Robotics - First Bot Server[/b]
[b]Our Aim[/b] Software developers always set goals. Our goal - a revolution. People want to do tasks [b]now[/b]. Not wait. And because people want tasks done fast, the robotics industry has been growing at "Far more than the average" (61% demand) Us at FlareSoft have been working hard on our simple communication server "ComServer". ComServer was designed to be flawless, low memory consuming, and simple at the same time. [u]F[/u]irst we implemented an easy to use loader - where the user could dynamically change what port the server is on, run the server on more than one port, and request administrative actions overboard (non-LAN). [u]T[/u]hen we created a simple configuration document, for easy changes (such as name changing) on the server. We are still continuing development to make ComServer as [b]simple as possible[/b] for users.
[b]Who are we?[/b] The FlareSoft team consists of 3 [url=http://www.flaresoft.co.cc/images/nerds.jpg]Java programmers[/url].
[b]Thomas Nappo[/b] [i]Degree:[/i] .NET Programmer's Certificate, 85 WPM [i]89 WPM gross speed[/i] Typing Certificate [i]Experience:[/i] 2 years (3 in November) [i]More info:[/i] Founder of FlareSoft, also known as Canownueasy.
[b]Kevin Bacon[/b] [i]Degree:[/i] Assembly Programming Certificate, C++ Programming Certificate [i]Experience:[/i] 4 years [i]More info:[/i] N/A
[b]Steven Pomilia[/b] [i]Degree:[/i] N/A [i]Experience:[/i] 6 months [i]More info:[/i] Steven is the newbie of the team, however growing in experience everyday.
[b]What is it?[/b] Robotics can move mouse, type keys, scroll, and more. Unlike other robotic software, ours is a server, meaning others [across non-LAN] can execute commands for the robot to do. It's a simple solution for remote setup, account creations, and more. You can create queues of actions for the robot to perform and wait for specified command details are provided. There are millions of options to do with your robotic server.
[b]Where can I get it?[/b] [url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/ComServer%20%28Robot%29.rar][DOWNLOAD (.rar compressed file)][/url] [url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/ComServer%20%28Robot%29.zip][DOWNLOAD (.zip compressed file)][/url] [url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/9098208/ComServer%20%28Robot%29.exe][DOWNLOAD (.exe self-extracting executable file)[/url]

item.title: ComServer Robotics - First Bot Server (RC1)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“ApocalypseX, post:10, topic:365736”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461933.msg3379278#msg3379278 date=1287889117]

[quote author=Canownueazy link=topic=461933.msg3379272#msg3379272 date=1287888944]

I lol’d at your ‘certificates’, none of them are real degrees.

As for this, It’s basically RSBot but with a relay server?
[/quote]They are.
[/quote]Can I ask where you got this certification?

David, as newbie as I am on Mopar (:D) it’s real.
It’s not like, real… But yet, he’s taking College classes along with his regular courses as a normal kid (High School) but yet, he’s just removing some classes to throw in college classes so he can finish college earlier than what he wants. I do the same thing, but not for programming 'cause I am noob. :D[/quote]When I say ‘degree’, I mean you take a college credit class for computer sciences, and not just get ‘Certification’, but a real degree. (bachelors, etc)
And don’t talk to me like I don’t know about community colleges, my mom is the executive dean for Seattle Central Community College

And I could also get ‘certification’ in Java or almost any programming language by taking an easy online test, but it doesn’t really mean anything. (Normally, you would say something like 'I have certification in ________ from a community college or whatever.)
But yea, it’s been cleared up (he told me where he got it) so it doesn’t matter anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: ComServer Robotics - First Bot Server (RC1)
item.dc:creator: @Canownueazy Canownueazy
item.description:
@Canownueazy wrote:

[center]ComServer Robotics - First Bot Server

Our Aim
Software developers always set goals. Our goal - a revolution. People want to do tasks now. Not wait. And because people want tasks done fast, the robotics industry has been growing at “Far more than the average” (61% demand) Us at FlareSoft have been working hard on our simple communication server “ComServer”. ComServer was designed to be flawless, low memory consuming, and simple at the same time. First we implemented an easy to use loader - where the user could dynamically change what port the server is on, run the server on more than one port, and request administrative actions overboard (non-LAN). Then we created a simple configuration document, for easy changes (such as name changing) on the server. We are still continuing development to make ComServer as simple as possible for users.

Who are we?
The FlareSoft team consists of 3 Java programmers.

Thomas Nappo
Degree: .NET Programmer’s Certificate, 85 WPM 89 WPM gross speed Typing Certificate
Experience: 2 years (3 in November)
More info: Founder of FlareSoft, also known as Canownueasy.

Kevin Bacon
Degree: Assembly Programming Certificate, C++ Programming Certificate
Experience: 4 years
More info: N/A

Steven Pomilia
Degree: N/A
Experience: 6 months
More info: Steven is the newbie of the team, however growing in experience everyday.

What is it?
Robotics can move mouse, type keys, scroll, and more. Unlike other robotic software, ours is a server, meaning others [across non-LAN] can execute commands for the robot to do. It’s a simple solution for remote setup, account creations, and more. You can create queues of actions for the robot to perform and wait for specified command details are provided. There are millions of options to do with your robotic server.

Where can I get it?
